message.content:
Here's a healthy meal plan for you considering the dietary restrictions provided:

**Monday**
Breakfast: Overnight chia seed pudding with almond milk, topped with fresh berries and a drizzle of maple syrup
Lunch: Grilled chicken salad with mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, bell pepper, avocado, and lemon-tahini dressing
Dinner: Baked salmon with quinoa and roasted asparagus

**Tuesday**
Breakfast: Greek-style yogurt (dairy-free alternative) with sliced bananas, a handful of walnuts, and cinnamon
Lunch: Chickpea salad with red onion, cherry tomatoes, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper
Dinner: Grilled vegetable skewers with lentil soup

**Wednesday**
Breakfast: Green smoothie made with spinach, kale, frozen mango, unsweetened coconut milk, and a scoop of vanilla protein powder
Lunch: Quinoa salad with roasted red peppers, olives, cherry tomatoes, and feta cheese (skip the feta for dairy-free option)
Dinner: Stuffed bell peppers with brown rice, black beans, corn, and avocado

**Thursday**
Breakfast: Chia seed pudding made with coconut milk, topped with sliced strawberries and a sprinkle of shredded coconut
Lunch: Tuna salad wrap using dairy-free mayo, served with a mixed greens side salad
Dinner: Grilled tofu and vegetable stir-fry with brown rice

**Friday**
Breakfast: Dairy-free yogurt parfait with layers of granola, raspberries, and a drizzle of maple syrup
Lunch: Lentil soup with a side of whole-grain bread or crackers
Dinner: Baked lemon herb chicken with roasted sweet potatoes and green beans

**Saturday**
Breakfast: Avocado toast made on gluten-free bread, topped with cherry tomatoes and a sprinkle of chia seeds
Lunch: Quinoa tabbouleh salad with lemon-tahini dressing
Dinner: Grilled shrimp with sautéed spinach and lemon-garlic sauce (without garlic)

**Sunday**
Breakfast: Smoothie bowl with mixed berries, unsweetened almond milk, protein powder, and topped with chopped nuts (excluding almonds, pistachios, and cashews)
Lunch: Chickpea and vegetable curry served over cauliflower rice
Dinner: Baked eggplant parmesan (skip the cheese for dairy-free option) with a side of spaghetti squash

Remember to adjust portion sizes according to your nutritional needs and feel free to swap out vegetables or proteins as desired. Make sure you are getting enough healthy fats, protein, and complex carbohydrates in your meals to maintain overall health and energy levels.
